elements: Enough to support me for a little while in adequate comfort.
My intellect should be put to better use! But the pay is better than labourer's work.

Diligence: Extra effort. It might help, if I'm very lucky.

elements: I earn a little more; I stay a little later. Envy glints in the eye of the junior clerk who occupies my old desk.

Diligence: Extra effort. I don't know why I would bother.

Devotion: Extra effort. I don't know why I would bother.

elements: I suppose, theoretically, I could rise higher, if someone died.
Cryptic directions to the obscure address of a certain Morland, a dealer in the rarer sort of book.
The dim premises of Miss Morland, who deals in rare and sometimes dangerous books.
The house of Mr Strathcoyne, a collector of rare volumes. Strathcoyne will not sell his treasures. But a sufficiently cunning accomplice might gain entry.
